Domain description: The foundation of a trustworthy AI program. Ensuring that the organization has the proper management of its AI program in order to ensure security, effective risk management and compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing AI development and deployment.
Definition: The oversight mechanisms that address risks like bias, privacy infringement and misuse while fostering innovation and trust.

Domain description: The foundation of a trustworthy AI program. Ensuring that the organization has the proper management of its AI program in order to ensure security, effective risk management and compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing AI development and deployment.
Definition:
Program driving responsible uses and practices by prompting organizations and their internal teams to think more critically about context and potential or unexpected negative and
positive impacts.

Domain description: The foundation of a trustworthy AI program. Ensuring that the organization has the proper management of its AI program in order to ensure security, effective risk management and compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing AI development and deployment.
Definition:
Ensuring an organization stays current with the regulatory landscape (regulatory watch) and adheres to legal requirements, rules, and standards governing the
development, deployment, monitoring, and use of AI.

Domain description: The foundation of a trustworthy AI program. Ensuring that the organization has the proper management of its AI program in order to ensure security, effective risk management and compliance with relevant laws and regulations governing AI development and deployment.
Definition:
Addressing risks related to data sourcing, model development, deployment, and ongoing maintenance that leverage third-
party libraries, APIs, and pre-trained models.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition: Practices to ensure the safe and reliable operation of AI systems. It encompasses strategies to prevent unintended consequences, errors, and harm caused by AI applications.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition:
Controls to ensure stages involved in the development, deployment, and maintenance of AI systems drive trustworthy
AI

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition: Adherence of AI applications to established guidelines, regulations, and standards.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition: Mechanisms to ensure that interactions between AI systems and their users, other systems, and the environment occur in a safe and secure manner.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition:
Techniques to safeguard AI applications from various risks, vulnerabilities, and threats. These protective measures aim to ensure the robustness, security, and reliability of AI systems
throughout their lifecycle.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the usage” of AI through the application stack. Adhering to ethical standards and guidelines to ensure that AI systems respect human values and rights.
Definition:
Identifying, assessing, and mitigating potential risks and vulnerabilities that could impact the security, functionality, or reliability of an AI application and ensuring its ability to adapt, recover, and continue functioning effectively even in the face
of unexpected events, failures, or disruptions.

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition:
Understanding and interpreting the decisions made by
machine learning models. It provides visibility on how the model arrives at its predictions or results.

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition: Implementing the various stages involved in creating, deploying, and maintaining AI models.

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition: Adherence of AI models to established guidelines, regulations, and standards.

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition:
Controls that ensure the input prompts provided to AI models are safe, non-malicious, and aligned with the intended behavior of the model and protect the model from unauthorized access, tampering, or attacks. Equally checking that response prompts are safe and secure in terms of content
it may inadvertently reveal (i.e. PII).

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition: Restricting access to gen AI models, model parameters, training data, and APIs to prevent potential misuse and attack vectors.

Domain description:
Controls that “secure the model” layer as well as securing the usage of models. Implementing best practices for model training, validation, and evaluation to enhance
performance and reliability.
Definition:
Identifying and mitigating potential risks or vulnerabilities that
could compromise the integrity, security, or performance of the AI models and the interaction with those models.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition: Provide a common foundation for assessing data leveraged by AI systems; including data classifications, assigning predefined labels to each characteristic and historical context of the data

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition:
Maintaining the reliability, accuracy, and consistency of data
used by AI systems; ensuring that the data remains unaltered and is trustworthy.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition:
Adherence of the data used in AI systems to established guidelines, regulations, and standards including data residency
and sovereignty.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition: Safeguarding sensitive information, ensuring it is handled appropriately and remains private & accessible only to authorized systems & users

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition: Restricting access to data leveraged by AI systems to prevent potential misuse and attack vectors.

Domain description: Controls that “secure the data” layer.  Establishing clear guidelines for data collection, storage, and usage to ensure data quality and mitigate bias
Definition:
Tracking the usage and performance of data leveraged by AI
systems to enable detecting and responding to misuse or malicious activity

Domain description:
Implementing robust IT and cybersecurity measures to protect AI systems from cyber threats and unauthorized access. These are controls that organizations already need to enable across their technology landscape to meet security and privacy requirements but implemented for AI systems.  Note: This whitepaper does not include infrastructure or cloud
specific controls
Definition:
Organizations typically leverage industry frameworks (i.e. NIST 800-53, ISO 27xxx) or custom frameworks (i.e. IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services) to protect their entire
technology and hybrid cloud stack.
